intro: Peritassa compta, commonly known as the slender peritassa, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its simple, opposite, and often serrated leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by spherical, red berries. Peritassa compta thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
